sleepiness noun [U]
(TIREDNESS)
Add to word list
Add to word list
the feeling of being tired and wanting to sleep: Sleepiness can impair your work.
More examplesFewer examplesIf daytime sleepiness becomes overwhelming, limit nap time to a single nap of less than one hour, no later than 3 p.m.Sleepiness leads to accidents, and not just those in which drivers wake up behind the wheel.Some sleep disorders also can cause excessive sleepiness. Two-thirds say sleepiness makes concentrating and handling stress on the job harder.To cope with daytime sleepiness, 65 percent drink caffeinated beverages.
